intro: Dicrastylis costelloi var. eriantha, commonly known as the slender swamp rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown. It thrives in wet or marshy habitats, often found in coastal areas and swampy regions. This variant is distinguished by its hairy stems and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
